holidays.name: Earth Day
holidays.description: A global event dedicated to environmental protection and raising awareness about issues like pollution, conservation, and climate change.
holidays.origin: First celebrated in 1970, initiated by U.S. Senator Gaylord Nelson to promote environmental awareness and action worldwide.
holidays.funFact: Earth Day is now observed by over 1 billion people in 192 countries, making it the largest secular observance in the world!

holidays.name: National Jelly Bean Day
holidays.description: A sweet celebration honoring the colorful, tiny candy beans that come in countless flavors and make springtime tastier!
holidays.origin: Started in the United States to celebrate jelly beans, especially popular during Easter and spring seasons.
holidays.funFact: Jelly beans were popularized by American candy maker William Schrafft, who encouraged sending them to soldiers during the Civil War for an energy boost.

holidays.name: International Guide Dogs Day
holidays.description: A day to recognize the amazing guide dogs that help visually impaired people navigate life safely and independently.
holidays.origin: An international observance dedicated to raising awareness about guide dogs and the needs of their handlers, celebrated on the fourth Wednesday of April each year.
holidays.funFact: Guide dogs can be trained in over 40 commands and undergo up to two years of rigorous training before they can assist their handlers.

holidays.name: Hug a Plumber Day
holidays.description: A quirky unofficial day to appreciate hardworking plumbers and the vital services they provide to keep our water flowing and toilets flushing!
holidays.origin: Started as a fun, lighthearted way to thank plumbers who often work behind the scenes keeping plumbing problems at bay.
holidays.funFact: The world’s first recorded plumber was identified in Ancient Rome, where plumbing innovations like aqueducts and baths were first developed.
